title: Love Island Australia's Adam Farrugia is mercilessly mocked for his quirky bowlcut
text:
Love Island Australia's Adam Farrugia has left fans perplexed and amused by his very unusual haircut.

And after the Queensland plasterer, 27, made his reality TV debut on Monday night, it was only a matter of time before his 'do became a topic of conversation among viewers online.

Many fans took to social media to poke fun at his unique coif, with many likening him to Jim Carrey's character Lloyd in the movie Dumb and Dumber.

'Is anyone else getting Lloyd vibes?' Love Island Australia's Adam Farrugia , 27, (left) has been mercilessly mocked for his quirky bowlcut - with fans comparing him to Jim Carrey in Dumb And Dumber (right)

'Anyone else getting Lloyd vibes from Adam?' Tweeted one bemused fan alongside the hashtag #DumbAndDumber.

Another viewer shared a clip of Lloyd getting his iconic bowlcut in the movie, alongside the caption: 'Adam in hair and makeup before entering the #LoveIslandAU vila.'

Adam's flamboyant hairstyle also inspired comparisons to Ken from the movie Toy Story, Mr Spock from Star Treck and even a plastic Lego character.

Different look: Adam's interesting hair features long choppy bangs that extend around the circumference of his head

'Adam in hair and makeup before entering the #LoveIslandAU vila': Many fans took to social media to poke fun at his unique coif, with one sharing a clip of Lloyd getting his iconic bowlcut in the movie

Despite receiving less-than-stellar feedback about his haircut, Adam quickly became a favourite among fans thanks to his quick wit and self-deprecating humour.

'Despite a questionable haircut, Adam's actually funny,' a fan wrote.

'Adam is the best one in the villa hands down,' another agreed.

'Remember when Ken had plastic hair?' Adam's flamboyant hairstyle also inspired comparisons to Ken from the movie Toy Story

Poking fun: One person compared Adam's hairstyle looked to that of a Lego character

Out of this world! Another fan Tweeted: 'Adam's hair is giving me serious Mr Spock vibes and not in a good way'

Adam is a self-described 'mumma's boy' who claims to have never had a serious girlfriend.

'My dating history is dismal I've never really had a proper girlfriend,' he told Who magazine last week.

'I can be hard work, a typical Gemini. I’m all or nothing,' he explained.

Fan favourite! Despite receiving less-than-stellar feedback about his haircut, Adam quickly became a favourite among fans thanks to his quick wit and self-deprecating humour

Divisive: It was only a matter of time before his 'do became a topic of conversation among viewers online

'Some days I’m up and I’m all there and I’m happy as, then the next day I’m a bit standoffish, I just want to have a bit of me-time.'

During Monday night's premiere, the tattooed tradie revealed he was hoping to find a beautiful woman who can 'tolerate him'.

Love Island Australia continues Tuesday at 8:30pm on Channel Nine.
